intro: Utricularia longecalcarata, commonly known as the long-beak bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat, typically found in slow-moving freshwater environments. The plant possesses specialized bladders that function as pitfall traps to capture and digest small aquatic organisms. Its morphology includes slender stems and leaves that bear the trapping structures. Utricularia longecalcarata is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor water conditions.
